articles.summary: According to 2024 accessibility report, nearly 98% of websites fail to include proper alt text on all their images. AltEdge makes it possible to add it once and keep it up-to-date. It's a tool that automates the process of adding alt text to a website.

articles.title: Mind over machine: Neuralink's breakthrough lets patient control robot with thoughts

articles.summary: Neuralink claims to have achieved a new milestone in brain-computer interface technology. An ALS patient successfully controlled a robotic arm using only his thoughts in a recent demonstration. The technology is called Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI) and was developed by Neuralink.

articles.title: Police warn against viral ‘AI homeless man' prank after parents panic call

The prank involves people creating AI-generated images of a dishevelled homeless man and sending them to friends or family to provoke shock or fear.

articles.title: A new information-theory framework reveals when multi-agent AI systems truly work as a team
articles.summary: A new framework from Northeastern University sets out to measure real teamwork in agentic AI systems. It reveals when multi-agent AI systems truly work as a team and when they're just running side-by-side with other agents. The framework is based on an information-theory framework.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is beginning to bridge the gap between one-size-fits-all screening guidelines and personalized medicine. Major health organizations differ on when and how often women at average risk should get screened. articles.title: Centre to Introduce AI in Curriculum from Class 3 from 2026-27
articles.author: Kashmir Observer
articles.summary: The Ministry of Education is set to introduce Artificial Intelligence in the school curriculum for all students from Class 3 onwards from next academic year (2026-27). A framework is being developed for AI integration across grades, according to officials, and a framework will be developed for integration of AI across grades.

articles.title: From fixing teeth to building tech: How an Indian-origin dentist mastered AI and landed a ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Anshul Gandhi, a dentist, transitioned to AI engineering and landed a job at Apple. He is now a senior engineer at Apple's AI division. He used to work as a dentist. He now works as an AI engineer. He works in the AI division of Apple.

articles.title: AI bubble warning issued by influential central bank
articles.author: The Capital Journal
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence bubble warning signs are getting harder to ignore, as this article points out. It's not a good idea to ignore it. It can be dangerous and dangerous and it's getting more and more difficult to ignore. It is not safe to ignore them.

articles.title: Feeling overwhelmed?
articles.author: Jim Thompson
articles.summary: Jim Thompson is a columnist for The Highland County Press. His column is brought to the readers free of charge. Jim recommends a movie called "The Dish" about the moon landing in 1969. Jim believes that despite all the computing power we have today, it is up to us to police what we listen to and watch.
